name: CreateAppObjectsPublishedApp
rule: !resource.App.stream.Empty() and resource.App.HasPrivilege("read") and (resource.objectType = "userstate" or resource.objectType = "sheet" or resource.objectType = "story" or resource.objectType = "bookmark" or resource.objectType = "snapshot" or resource.objectType = "embeddedsnapshot" or resource.objectType = "hiddenbookmark") and !user.IsAnonymous()
comment: If you have read rights on an published app you should be able to create sheets, stories, bookmarks and snapshots belonging to that app

name: Stream
rule: (resource.resourcetype = "App" and resource.stream.HasPrivilege("read")) or ((resource.resourcetype = "App.Object" and resource.published ="true" and resource.objectType != "app_appscript" and resource.objectType != "loadmodel") and resource.app.stream.HasPrivilege("read"))
comment: The user should see the resource if he/she has read access to the stream it is published to

name: Z_OEM_DEVELOPER
rule:
user.environment.group = "Developer" and
 ((resource.owner = user and resource.stream.Empty()) or (resource.app.HasPrivilege("read") and resource.published ="false" ))
comment: Extends the Z_OEM_APP_ACCESS (CONSUMER) rule. This user can also create own apps and create sheets in apps (like a contributor). He can't publish.

name: Z_CONTRIBUTOR
comment: Extends the Z_OEM_APP_ACCESS (CONSUMER) rule. This user can also create own sheets in predefined apps. He can't create apps, only a developer can do this.

name: Z_OEM_APP_ACCESS (CONSUMER)
rule: resource.stream.HasPrivilege("read") or (resource.resourcetype = "App.Object" and resource.published ="true" and resource.app.HasPrivilege("read"))
comment: The basis rule on which all others depend. Provide access to an app if you already have access to the stream.

name: Z_AUDITOR
comment: display all for auditors

name: Z_QMC_ADMINS_CUSTOMER
comment: QMC Menu only. Only give access to stream if the name of the stream match the AD group. Note, we disabled the default Stream Rule

name: Z_QMC_ADMINS_CUSTOMER2
rule:
user.environment.group = "Admin" 
and 
( 
resource.HasPrivilege("read") 
or
 resource.app.HasPrivilege("read")
and
resource.stream.name != "Everyone"
 )
comment: Administrators are only allowed to maintain the apps and app.object in the QMC

name: Z_Root_ALL
comment: Root: Hub and QMC full access

name: Z_SLIDE_GENERATOR
rule: resource.name="API apps" and ( user.environment.group="TECHNICAL" or user.environment.group="GENERIC" )

name: SAAS DEMO - License rule to grant user access
comment: Rule to set up automatic user access for each user that has received a ticket via your SaaS platform

name: License rule to grant user access
comment: Rule to set up automatic user access

name: DefaultHostAccess
comment: Allow BinarySync to get chunks from any node

name: ResourcesOnNonCentralNodes
comment: All resources need to be accessible on the non-central nodes, except the monitoring apps

name: ResourcesOnCentralNode
comment: All resources need to be accessible on the central node

name: ManageAnalyticConnection
comment: RootAdmin, ContentAdmin and SecurityAdmin roles should be able to manage an analytical connection

name: ReadAnalyticConnectionEveryone
comment: Non-anonymous users can read an analytic connection

name: CreateOdagRequest
comment: Non-anonymous users with read access to the link can create new Requests using that link

name: DeleteOdagLinkUsage
comment: Non-anonymous users with read access on the selection app can delete OdagLinkUsages for that app

name: ReadOdagLinkUsage
comment: Non-anonymous users with read access to the selection app can read its OdagLinkUsages

name: CreateOdagLinkUsage
comment: Non-anonymous users with read access to the selectionApp and read access to the link can create OdagLinkUsages

name: ReadOdagLinks
comment: Non-anonymous users can read ODAG links

name: CreateOdagLinks
comment: Non-anonymous users with read access to the ODAG template app can create links and it is possible to create a link without first knowing the template app

name: HubSections
comment: Allows all users to access all hub sections

name: File upload connection object
comment: Data connection used for uploading files to server

name: Temporary content
comment: Allows everyone except anonymous users to create temporary content

name: Default content library
comment: The default content library should be visible for all users

name: AuditAdminQmcSections
comment: Audit admin should have access rights to audit related sections

name: AuditAdmin
comment: Audit admin should have access rights to audit entities

name: ContentAdminQmcSections
comment: Content admin should have access rights to content related sections

name: ContentAdminRulesAccess
rule: user.roles = "ContentAdmin" and resource.category = "Security" and (resource.resourcefilter matches "Stream_\w{8}-\w{4}-\w{4}-\w{4}-\w{12}" or resource.resourcefilter matches "DataConnection_\w{8}-\w{4}-\w{4}-\w{4}-\w{12}" or resource.resourcefilter matches "ContentLibrary_\w{8}-\w{4}-\w{4}-\w{4}-\w{12}" or resource.resourcefilter matches "Extension_\w{8}-\w{4}-\w{4}-\w{4}-\w{12}")
comment: Content admin should have access rights to manage security rules for streams, data connections, content libraries and extensions

name: ContentAdmin
comment: Content admin should have access rights to content related entities

name: DeploymentAdminQmcSections
comment: Deployment admin should have access rights to deployment related sections

name: DeploymentAdminRulesAccess
comment: Deployment admin should have access rights to manage sync and license rules

name: DeploymentAdminAppAccess
comment: Deployment admin should have access rights to see and update apps in order to handle sync rules

name: DeploymentAdmin
comment: Deployment admin should have access rights to deployment related entities

name: SecurityAdminQmcSections
comment: Security admin should have access rights to security related sections

name: SecurityAdminServerNodeConfiguration
comment: Security admin should have read rights on ServerNodeConfiguration entity

name: SecurityAdmin
comment: Security admin should have access rights to security related entities

name: RootAdmin
comment: Root admin should have full access rights

name: CreateCloudCredentials
comment: The user should be able to create cloud credentials for the stream he/she has create access to

name: ReadCloudCredentials
comment: The user should see cloud credentials if he/she has read access to the stream they are related to

name: Shared content manage content
comment: Allows everyone that can update a shared content to manage its corresponding files

name: Shared content see content
comment: Allows everyone that can see a shared content to see its corresponding files

name: UpdateAppContentFiles
comment: Allows everyone that can update an app to manage it's content files

name: ReadAppContentFiles
comment: Allows everyone that can see an app to see it's content files

name: Content library manage content
comment: Allows everyone that can update a content library to manage its corresponding files

name: Content library content
comment: Allows everyone that can see a content library to see its corresponding files

name: Extension manage content
comment: Allows everyone that can update an extension to manage its corresponding files

name: Extension static content
comment: Allows everyone that can see an extension to see its corresponding files

name: Installed static content
comment: Allows everyone to read installed static content

name: Extension
comment: Everyone can view extensions

name: FolderDataConnection
rule: resource.type = "folder" and (user.roles = "RootAdmin" or user.roles = "ContentAdmin" or user.roles = "SecurityAdmin")
comment: It should be possible for admins to create folder data connections

name: DataConnection
comment: It should be possible to create data connections except of type folder

name: ReadFileReference
comment: Everyone is allowed to read file references

name: UpdateAppContents
comment: If you have update rights on the app you should be able to update app content belonging to that app

name: ReadAppContents
comment: If you have read rights on the app you should be able to read app content belonging to that app

name: UpdateAppInternals
comment: If you have update rights on the app you should be able to create/update/read/delete app internals belonging to that app

name: ReadAppInternals
comment: If you have read rights on the app you should be able to read app internals belonging to that app

name: UpdateAppDataSegments
comment: If you have update rights on the app you should be able to create/update/read/delete app data segments belonging to that app

name: ReadAppDataSegments
comment: If you have read rights on the app you should be able to read app data segments belonging to that app

name: CreateAppObjectsUnPublishedApp
comment: If you have read rights on an unpublished app you should be able to create app objects belonging to that app

name: Offline access
comment: Everyone is allowed offline access to the app they are allowed to see except anonymous users

name: CreateApp
comment: Everyone is allowed to create apps except anonymous users

name: Owner
rule: resource.IsOwned() and (resource.owner = user and !((resource.resourcetype = "App" and !resource.stream.Empty()) or (resource.resourcetype = "App.Object" and resource.published = "true")))
comment: The owner of a resource should be able to do Update and Delete actions if the resource is not published to a stream

name: OwnerPublishAppObject
rule: resource.IsOwned() and resource.owner = user and resource.approved = "false"
comment: The owner of an app object should be able to publish an object unless it is approved

name: OwnerPublish
comment: The owner of an app or a stream should be able to publish

name: OwnerRead
comment: The owner of a resource should be able to see the resource if it is published to a stream

name: ServiceAccount
comment: The service accounts should be able to do all actions
